document.ModsDocTitle: Streamlining the use of BOLD specimen data to record species distributions: a case study with ten Nearctic species of Microgastrinae (Hymenoptera: Braconidae)
document.docAuthor: Fernandez-Triana, Jose L, Penev, Lyubomir, Ratnasingham, Sujeevan, Smith, M. Alex, Sones, Jayme, Telfer, Angela, deWaard, Jeremy R. & Hebert, Paul D. N.
document.masterDocTitle: Streamlining the use of BOLD specimen data to record species distributions: a case study with ten Nearctic species of Microgastrinae (Hymenoptera: Braconidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: A cosmopolitan species ( Yu et al. 2012 ), it was recorded from three provinces in Canada (BC, NB, ON) by Fernandez-Triana (2010) , but no locality records were provided at the time. Here we present new details about the distribution of this species in Canada, based on examined specimens from the BIO and CNC collections. Data for those specimens was extracted from BOLD.
